com.kevalpatel2106.fingerprintdialog

Interface AuthenticationCallback


  • public interface AuthenticationCallback
    Created by Keval on 08/04/18. Callback to get the results of the fingerprint authentication. These callbacks defines homogeneous way of getting callbacks for fingerprint authentication process across Android versions.
    Author:
    kevalpatel2106

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void authenticationCanceledByUser()
      This callback will be called whenever the user cancels the fingerprint authentication by clicking the negative/cancel button on the dialog.
      void fingerprintAuthenticationNotSupported()
      This method will notify the application whenever,
      There is no finger print hardware on the device The device is running on the android version below Build.VERSION_CODES.M
      In above cases the library won't display any fingerprint dialog and won't perform any authentication.
      void hasNoFingerprintEnrolled()
      This callback will notify the application whenever user has not registered any fingerprint into the phone settings.
      void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode, CharSequence errString)
      Called when an unrecoverable error has been encountered and the operation is complete.
      void onAuthenticationFailed()
      This callback indicates that the scanned finger does not match with the enrolled finger.
      void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode, CharSequence helpString)
      Called when a recoverable error has been encountered during authentication.
      void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
      This callback indicates that the fingerprint authentication is successful.

    • Method Detail

      • fingerprintAuthenticationNotSupported

        void fingerprintAuthenticationNotSupported()
        This method will notify the application whenever,
      • There is no finger print hardware on the device
      • The device is running on the android version below Build.VERSION_CODES.M

        • In above cases the library won't display any fingerprint dialog and won't perform any authentication. The developer should use any other way of authenticating the user, like pin or password to authenticate the user.

  • hasNoFingerprintEnrolled

    void hasNoFingerprintEnrolled()
    This callback will notify the application whenever user has not registered any fingerprint into the phone settings.

    In above cases the library won't display any fingerprint dialog and won't perform any authentication. Developer should redirect the user to the "Settings" application (using FingerprintUtils.openSecuritySettings(Context)) and prompt the user to enroll at least one fingerprint.

    See Also:
    FingerprintUtils.openSecuritySettings(Context)

  • onAuthenticationError

    void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode,
                           @Nullable
                           CharSequence errString)
    Called when an unrecoverable error has been encountered and the operation is complete. No further callbacks will be made on this object. The library will stop scanning for the fingerprint after this callback.
    Parameters:
    errorCode - A ErrorCodes identifying the error message.
    errString - A human-readable string that can be shown in UI
    See Also:
    ErrorCodes

  • onAuthenticationHelp

    void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode,
                          @Nullable
                          CharSequence helpString)
    Called when a recoverable error has been encountered during authentication. The help string is provided to give the user guidance for what went wrong, such as "Sensor dirty, please clean it." The library will continue to scan for the fingerprint after this callback.
    Parameters:
    helpCode - A HelperCodes identifying the error message.
    helpString - A human-readable string that can be shown in UI
    See Also:
    HelperCodes

  • authenticationCanceledByUser

    void authenticationCanceledByUser()
    This callback will be called whenever the user cancels the fingerprint authentication by clicking the negative/cancel button on the dialog.

  • onAuthenticationSucceeded

    void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
    This callback indicates that the fingerprint authentication is successful. The library will stop scanning for the fingerprint after this callback and dismiss the dialog.

  • onAuthenticationFailed

    void onAuthenticationFailed()
    This callback indicates that the scanned finger does not match with the enrolled finger. The library will continue to scan for the fingerprint after this callback.
